TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit TrackBar extends System.Windows.Forms.Control implements class System.ComponentModel.ISupportInitialize
Public Class TrackBar Inherits Control Implements ISupportInitialize
type TrackBar = class inherit Control interface ISupportInitialize

Docs.summary: Represents a standard Windows track bar.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar> is a scrollable control similar to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ScrollBar> control. You can configure ranges through which the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Value%2A> property of a track bar scrolls by setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Minimum%2A> property to specify the lower end of the range and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Maximum%2A> property to specify the upper end of the range.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.LargeChange%2A> property defines the increment to add or subtract from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Value%2A> property when clicks occur on either side of the scroll box. The track bar can be displayed horizontally or vertically.
You can use this control to input numeric data obtained through the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Value%2A> property. You can display this numeric data in a control or use it in code.
## Examples The following code example displays a form containing a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar> control and a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox> control. The example demonstrates setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Maximum%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.TickFrequency%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.LargeChange%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.SmallChange%2A> properties and handling the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Scroll> event. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox> contents are updated to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Value%2A> property value when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Scroll> event occurs.
[!code-cpp[System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar/VB/source.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar> is created with a default horizontal orientation and a range of 0 to 10, with a tick mark shown for every value.

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the height or width of the track bar is being automatically sized.
Docs.value: if the track bar is being automatically sized; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks You can set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.AutoSize%2A> property to `true` to cause the track bar to adjust its height (if horizontally aligned) or width (if vertically aligned). The height or width is adjusted to a standard size based on the screen resolution on which the track bar is displayed. Set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.AutoSize%2A> property to `false` if you want to adjust the size yourself.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Custom Event AutoSizeChanged As EventHandler

Docs.summary: Occurs when the value of the property changes.

remarks.format:
## Remarks For more information about handling events, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/docs/standard/events/index.md).
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the use of this member. In the example, an event handler reports on the occurrence of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.AutoSizeChanged> event. This report helps you to learn when the event occurs and can assist you in debugging. To report on multiple events or on events that occur frequently, consider replacing <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MessageBox.Show%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> with <xref:System.Console.WriteLine%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> or appending the message to a multiline <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox>.
To run the example code, paste it into a project that contains an instance of type <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar> named `TrackBar1`. Then ensure that the event handler is associated with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.AutoSizeChanged> event.
[!code-csharp[System.Windows.Forms.EventExamples#620](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.EventExamples/CS/EventExamples.cs#620)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.EventExamples#620](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.EventExamples/VB/EventExamples.vb#620)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks The Visual Studio design environment uses this method to start the initialization of a component that is used on a form or used by another component. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.EndInit%2A> method ends the initialization. Using <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.BeginInit%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.EndInit%2A> methods prevents the control from being used before it is fully initialized.

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value to be added to or subtracted from the property when the scroll box is moved a large distance.
Docs.value: A numeric value. The default is 5.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When the user presses the PAGE UP or PAGE DOWN key or clicks the track bar on either side of the scroll box, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Value%2A> property changes according to the value set in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.LargeChange%2A> property. You might consider setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.LargeChange%2A> value to a percentage of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Height%2A> (for a vertically oriented track bar) or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Width%2A> (for a horizontally oriented track bar) value. This keeps the distance your track bar moves proportionate to its size.
## Examples The following code example displays a form containing a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar> control and a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox> control. The example demonstrates setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Maximum%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.TickFrequency%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.LargeChange%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.SmallChange%2A> properties and handling the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Scroll> event. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox> contents are updated to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Value%2A> property value when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Scroll> event occurs.
[!code-cpp[System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar/VB/source.vb#1)]

Docs.exception: The assigned value is less than 0.

Call the `InitializeTrackBar` method from the form's constructor or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form.Load> event-handling method.

abstract member OnRightToLeftLayoutChanged : EventArgs -> unit override this.OnRightToLeftLayoutChanged : EventArgs -> unit

Docs.param: An that contains the event data.
Docs.summary: Raises the event.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate. For more information, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/docs/standard/events/index.md).
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.OnRightToLeftLayoutChanged%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

block.para: When overriding in a derived class, be sure to call the base class' method so that registered delegates receive the event.

remarks.format:

Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate. For more information, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/docs/standard/events/index.md).
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.OnScroll%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Windows::Forms::Orientation Orientation { System::Windows::Forms::Orientation get(); void set(System::Windows::Forms::Orientation value); };
member this.Orientation : System.Windows.Forms.Orientation with get, set

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the horizontal or vertical orientation of the track bar.
Docs.value: One of the values.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Orientation%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Orientation.Horizontal?displayProperty=nameWithType>, the scroll box moves from left to right as the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Value%2A> increases. When the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Orientation%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Orientation.Vertical?displayProperty=nameWithType>, the scroll box moves from bottom to top as the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Value%2A> increases.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to set some of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar> properties.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Custom Event Scroll As EventHandler

Docs.summary: Occurs when either a mouse or keyboard action moves the scroll box.

remarks.format:
## Remarks For more information about handling events, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/docs/standard/events/index.md).
## Examples The following code example shows how to implement the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Scroll> event to modify information labels on a form, based on the scrolling of the scroll box on a track bar. The example requires a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form> with three track bars and three labels placed on it.
[!code-cpp[TrackBar#3](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Trackbar/CPP/form1.cpp#3)] [!code-csharp[TrackBar#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Trackbar/CS/form1.cs#3)] [!code-vb[TrackBar#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Trackbar/VB/form1.vb#3)]
The following code example displays a form that contains a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar> control and a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox> control. The example demonstrates setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Maximum%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.TickFrequency%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.LargeChange%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.SmallChange%2A> properties and handling the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Scroll> event. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox> contents are updated to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Value%2A> property value when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Scroll> event occurs.

Docs.param: The lower limit of the range of the track bar.
The upper limit of the range of the track bar.
Docs.summary: Sets the minimum and maximum values for a .

remarks.format: ## Remarks You can use this method to set the entire range for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar> at the same time. To set the minimum or maximum values individually, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Minimum%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Maximum%2A> properties. If the `minValue` parameter is greater than the `maxValue` parameter, `maxValue` is set equal to `minValue`.

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the value added to or subtracted from the property when the scroll box is moved a small distance.
Docs.value: A numeric value. The default value is 1.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When the user presses one of the arrow keys, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Value%2A> property changes according to the value set in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.SmallChange%2A> property.
You might consider setting the value of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.SmallChange%2A> to a percentage of the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Height%2A> (for a vertically oriented track bar) or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Width%2A> (for a horizontally oriented track bar) property. This sets the distance your track bar moves proportionate to its size.
## Examples The following code example displays a form that contains a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar> control and a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox> control. The example demonstrates setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Maximum%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.TickFrequency%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.LargeChange%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.SmallChange%2A> properties and handling the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Scroll> event. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox> contents are updated to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Value%2A> property value when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Scroll> event occurs.
[!code-cpp[System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar/VB/source.vb#1)]

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the delta between ticks drawn on the control.
Docs.value: The numeric value representing the delta between ticks. The default is 1.

remarks.format:
## Remarks For a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar> with a large range of values between the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Minimum%2A> and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Maximum%2A> properties, it might be impractical to draw all the ticks for values on the control. For example, if you have a control with a range of 100, passing in a value of 5 here causes the control to draw 20 ticks. In this case, each tick represents five units in the range of values.
## Examples The following code example displays a form that contains a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar> control and a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox> control. The example demonstrates setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Maximum%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.TickFrequency%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.LargeChange%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.SmallChange%2A> properties and handling the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Scroll> event. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox> contents are updated to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Value%2A> property value when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Scroll> event occurs.
[!code-cpp[System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar/VB/source.vb#1)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating how to display the tick marks on the track bar.
Docs.value: One of the values. The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.TickStyle%2A> property to modify the manner in which the tick marks are displayed on the track bar.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.TickStyle%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Minimum%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Maximum%2A> properties and how to handle the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.ValueChanged> event. To run the example, paste the following code into a form that contains a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar> control named `TrackBar1` and a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox> control named `TextBox1`. Call the `InitializeTrackBar` method from the form's constructor or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form.Load> event-handling method.
[!code-cpp[System.Windows.Forms.TrackBarExample#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.TrackBarExample/CPP/form1.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Windows.Forms.TrackBarExample#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.TrackBarExample/CS/form1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.TrackBarExample#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.TrackBarExample/VB/form1.vb#1)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a numeric value that represents the current position of the scroll box on the track bar.
Docs.value: A numeric value that is within the and range. The default value is 0.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Value%2A> property contains the number that represents the current position of the scroll box on the track bar.
## Examples The following code example displays a form that contains a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar> control and a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox> control. The example demonstrates setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Maximum%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.TickFrequency%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.LargeChange%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.SmallChange%2A> properties and handling the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Scroll> event. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox> contents are updated to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Value%2A> property value when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Scroll> event occurs.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Custom Event ValueChanged As EventHandler

Docs.summary: Occurs when the property of a track bar changes, either by movement of the scroll box or by manipulation in code.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use this event to update other controls when the value represented in the track bar changes.
For more information about handling events, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/docs/standard/events/index.md).
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.TickStyle%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Minimum%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Maximum%2A> members and how to handle the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.ValueChanged> event. To run the example, paste the following code into a form that contains a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar> control name `TrackBar1` and a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox> control named `TextBox1`. Call the `InitializeTrackBar` method from the form's constructor or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form.Load> event-handling method.
[!code-cpp[System.Windows.Forms.TrackBarExample#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.TrackBarExample/CPP/form1.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Windows.Forms.TrackBarExample#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.TrackBarExample/CS/form1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.TrackBarExample#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.TrackBarExample/VB/form1.vb#1)]
